author: Chris Mitchell
title: Grammy 2017 Winners: The Full List
text:
0 
The 59th annual Grammy Awards are here, although some of Hip Hop’s biggest stars most likely won’t be in attendance for the ceremony at Los Angeles’ Staples Center on Sunday night (February 12). 
Several nominees for Best Rap Album are skipping the show, with Kanye West expected to make good on his promise to boycott the awards if Frank Ocean wasn’t nominated (he wasn’t, in what was kind of a big deal ) and Drake out on tour in Europe. ScHoolboy Q recently said he’d probably pass on the show unless his daughter wanted to check it out. 
Plenty of other Hip Hop and R&B notables are attending though, with Chance The Rapper, Rick Ross, CeeLo, 2 Chainz, French Montana and many more already past the red carpet. 
Beyoncé led the pack of nominees with nine, while Drake, Rihanna, and Kanye West scored eight nominations, and Chance The Rapper had seven. 
Chance will perform during the show and has already won Best Rap Performance for “No Problems” featuring Lil Wayne and 2 Chainz. He’s also up for Best New Artist in a field that also includes Anderson .Paak. 
— Recording Academy (@RecordingAcad) February 12, 2017 
The majority of awards have already been announced, with the marquee categories still being held until the live television broadcast. 
Drake’s “Hotline Bling” won for Best Rap/Sung Collaboration, as well as for Best Rap Song, while Solange took home Best R&B Performance. Congrats Best Rap/Sung Collaboration "Hotline Bling" @Drake #GRAMMYs 
— Recording Academy (@RecordingAcad) February 12, 2017 Congrats Best Rap Song "Hotline Bling" Aubrey Graham & Paul Jefferies, songwriters ( @Drake ) #GRAMMYs 
— Recording Academy (@RecordingAcad) February 12, 2017 Congrats Best R&B Performance "Cranes In The Sky" @solangeknowles #GRAMMYs 
— Recording Academy (@RecordingAcad) February 12, 2017 
*This is a live article. More to come throughout the night.* 
Here are the nominations. Winners are in bold. 
Record Of The Year
